Create a scatter plot with pie charts representing topic distributions at each sample coordinate.

Source: R/plot_scatter_pie.R
plot_scatter_pie.Rd

This function visualizes topic proportions for each sample in a dataset using pie charts positioned at their corresponding spatial or embedding coordinates. Each pie chart represents the distribution of topics for a single cell/spot, and a legend provides the color mapping for each topic.

plot_scatter_pie(
  object,
  x,
  radius = 0.005,
  xrange = c(0, 1),
  yrange = c(0, 1),
  figsize = c(10, 10),
  palette = NULL,
  legend_markersize = 10,
  legend_ncol = 1,
  save = NULL,
  transparent = FALSE
)

Arguments

object

A MuData object containing multimodal single-cell data, including topic distributions and coordinates.

x

A name of the embedding to use for plotting (e.g., UMAP, PCA). If equal to ’Spatial’ tries to use spot coordinates.

radius

The radius of the pie charts. Default is 0.005.

xrange

The range of x-coordinates to display in the plot. Default is c(0, 1).

yrange

The range of y-coordinates to display in the plot. Default is c(0, 1).

figsize

The size of the figure (width, height) in inches. Default is c(10, 10).

palette

A list mapping topics to colors. If NULL, a default palette is generated. Default is NULL.

legend_markersize

The size of the markers in the legend. Default is 10.

legend_ncol

The number of columns in the legend. Default is 1.

save

Path to save the figure. If None, the figure is displayed but not saved. Default is NULL.

transparent

Whether to save the figure with a transparent background. Default is FALSE.

Note

The xrange and yrange parameters allow zooming into specific regions of the plot.

Contents
